lines.content: > ‚ÄúYour mind is for having ideas, not holding them.‚Äù ‚Äì David Allen ([source](https://dansilvestre.com/productivity-quotes))
DukePro frees your mind of having to remember things you need to do. It's,
All you need to do is,
4. let it manage your tasks for you üòâ
If you Java programmer, you can use it to practice Java too. Here's the `main` method:

[T], unfinished, learn how to play the guitae
- Add tasks that are not time sensitive and can be completed at any time.
- Add tasks that have deadlines such as homework or assignments.
- Add events that are happening such as someone's birthday party.
- List out all your current tasks or events.
- Mark your tasks as finished or unfinished.
- Delete tasks that have been finished.
### Find specific tasks and undo commands
Adding tasks that are not time sensitive: `todo {name of the task}`
`todo learn how to play the guitar`
Adds a todo task with the task name being "learn how to play the guitar" and displays how many tasks are currently inside the task list.
I gotchu fam. Your task has been added:
[T][ ] learn how to play the guitar
You have 1 task(s). Stop procrastinating bro.
Adding tasks that have a deadline: `deadline {name of the task} /by {date of the deadline} {optional: time of the deadline}`
- The date of the deadline should be written in the form of DD/MM/YYYY.
- Adding the time of the deadline is optional. Times should be written in the 24-hour format (1000).
Adds a deadline task with the task name being "math assignment" and deadline being 23/3/2022. Also displays how many tasks are currently inside the task list.
- If a time was inputted, the time of the deadline will also be displayed, specifically 10:00.
I gotchu fam. Your task has been added:
You have 2 task(s). Stop procrastinating bro.
I gotchu fam. Your task has been added:
You have 2 task(s). Stop procrastinating bro.
Adding events that occur on a certain date and during a time frame: `event {name of the event} /at {date of the event} {optional: start time of the event - end time of the event}`
- The date of the event should be written in the form of DD/MM/YYYY.
- Adding the time frame of the event is optional. Times should be written in the 24-hour format (1000).
Adds an event with the event name being "birthday celebration" and event date being 23/3/2022. Also displays how many tasks are currently inside the task list.
- If a time frame was inputted, the start and end time of the event will also be displayed, specifically 10:00-12:00.
I gotchu fam. Your task has been added:
You have 3 task(s). Stop procrastinating bro.
I gotchu fam. Your task has been added:
You have 3 task(s). Stop procrastinating bro.
Listing out all the events currently in the task list: `list`
Lists out all the events currently in the task list.
- The first letter represents what type of task it is (T is a todo task, D is a task with a deadline and E is an event)
- The second box represents whether the task is finished (`[ ]` for unfinished and `[X]` for finished)
Here are your tasks. You better start now:
1.[T][X] learn how to play the guitar
Marks a task as finished: `mark {number of the task}`
Marks and displays the first task as finished.
Nice one lah, finally doing your work.
[T][X] learn how to play the guitar
Marks a task as unfinished: `unmark {number of the task}`
Marks and displays the first task as unfinished.
[T][ ] learn how to play the guitar
Deletes a task from the task list: `delete {number of the task}`
Deletes the first task from the task list and displays the remaining number of tasks in the task list.
I hope you're not deleting this just to avoid work:
[T][ ] learn how to play the guitar
You have 2 task(s). Stop procrastinating bro.
Finds tasks in the task list that contain the keyword inputted: `find {keyword}`
Finds any task that contains the word "birthday" in their name.
No problem fam. Here are the tasks that match the keyword:
Undoes any command that edited the task list: `undo`
todo learn how to play the guitae
A todo task is added to the task list with task name being "learn how to play the guitae" which is a typo. After undo is inputted, the todo task is removed.
I gotchu fam. Your task has been added:
[T][ ] learn how to play the guitae
You have 3 task(s). Stop procrastinating bro.
Here are your tasks. You better start now:
3.[T][ ] learn how to play the guitae
Don't anyhow type commands if you want me to undo it.
Here are your tasks. You better start now:
Terminates the program and displays the exit message.
* Represents a program that helps to track tasks using a task list.
* The program allows for different types of tasks to be added, tasks to be deleted or marked as finished/unfinished
* as well as viewing the current list of tasks.
* "todo {task name}" to add a task with no date associated to it.
* "deadline {task name} /by {deadline date} {optional: deadline time}" to add tasks that have a deadline associated to
* it. Deadline dates are written in the form of DD/MM/YYYY (1/1/2022 or 31/12/2022). Deadline times are written in the
* "event {task name} /at {event date} {optional: event start time - end time}" to add events with a date and
* potentially a start plus end time associated to them. Deadline dates are written in the form of DD/MM/YYYY (1/1/2022
* or 31/12/2022). Event start time - end time is written in the form of two 24-hour times (0000-0200 or 1800-2000).
* "list" to view the tasks added to the task list.
* "mark {task number}" to mark the task corresponding to the task number as finished.
* "unmark {task number}" to mark the task corresponding to the task number as unfinished.
* "delete {task number}" to remove the task corresponding to the task number from the task list.
* "find {key word}" to find any tasks with a task name containing the keyword.
* "undo" to undo the last task that edited the task list.
/** A task list to store all the tasks */
* Constructor for a Candice object encapsulating a TaskList object by using a Path object to instantiate a Storage
* object which will be used by the TaskList to parse any tasks added from previous sessions.
* @param storagePath The path to the storage file, specifically the path to the task list text file.
* @throws IOException If there was an error in creating the storage file.
* Default constructor for a Candice object, using the default storage.
* @throws IOException If there was an error in creating the storage file.
* Executes the command inputted and returns the response corresponding to the command executed.
* Parses inputs and returns Action objects that can be resolved or throws Exceptions if the input cannot be parsed.
* Parses the name of the task before using the method parseDateAndTime as a helper to return a TimedTaskCommand.
* This method also checks for any formatting errors, specifically if /by was used for Deadlines and /at was used
* @param taskType The CommandType of the command given, Deadline or Event.
* @param taskDescription The description of the task (name of the task, the timed task date and timed task timing).
* @return An instance of a TimedTaskCommand encapsulating the command given.
* @throws EmptyTimingException If there was no date and time given for a deadline or event task.
* @throws InvalidDateException If there was a date inputted that does not follow the format or does not exist.
* @throws InvalidFormattingException If there was a command inputted that did not follow the format.
* @throws InvalidTimeException If there was a time inputted that was not a 4 digit 24-hour time.
private static Command.TimedTaskCommand parseTimedTaskCommand(CommandType taskType, String taskDescription)

* @throws InvalidFormattingException If there was a command inputted that did not follow the format.
* @throws InvalidTimeException If there was a time inputted that was not a 4 digit 24-hour time.
private static Command.TimedTaskCommand parseDateAndTime(CommandType taskType, String taskName,
String taskDateAndTime) throws InvalidDateException, InvalidFormattingException, InvalidTimeException {

* Parses the command given to return a Command object encapsulating the command just given.

return "Sup bro! My name is Candice.\nI'm here to help you track your tasks!";
* Returns a message for when the Candice program shuts down.

* @param taskList The task list that the task was added to.
* @return The message reflecting that a task has been added.
public static String getMessageForAddTask(Task newTask, TaskList taskList) {
return "I gotchu fam. Your task has been added:\n"
+ "You have " + taskList.getLength() + " task(s). Stop procrastinating bro.";
* Returns a message for when a task is deleted from the task list.

* @return The message reflecting that a task has been deleted.
public static String getMessageForDeleteTask(Task removedTask, TaskList taskList) {
return "I hope you're not deleting this just to avoid work:\n"
+ "You have " + taskList.getLength() + " task(s). Stop procrastinating bro.";
* Returns a message for when a task has been marked as finished.

return "Nice one lah, finally doing your work.\n" + selectedTask.getStatus();
* Returns a message for when a task has been marked as unfinished.

return "Here are your tasks. You better start now:\n" + taskList;

return "No problem fam. Here are the tasks that match the keyword:\n"
* Returns a message for when a command has been undone.

return "Don't anyhow type commands if you want me to undo it.";

* Encapsulates commands that do not have a time associated to it, specifically todo and find.
public static class NonTimedCommand extends Command { // todo & find

* tasks with names that include the keyword inputted if the type of command inputted was "find".
* @param taskList The task list associated with this instance of Candice.
* @return A message reflecting that a todo task was added or the tasks that have a task name that includes the
assert this.commandType == CommandType.FIND : "Invalid command type used for NonTimedCommand";
* Encapsulates commands to edit or delete tasks in the task list.
public static class NumberedCommand extends Command { // mark, unmark & delete

* type of command inputted was "mark" and sets a task as unfinished if the type of command inputted was
* @param taskList The task list associated with this instance of Candice.
* @return A message reflecting that a task was deleted, marked as finished or marked as unfinished if the
* command type was delete, mark and unmark respectively.
* @throws IllegalArgumentException If the task number inputted was larger than the size of the task list or
public String resolve(TaskList taskList) throws IllegalArgumentException, InvalidMarkException {
assert this.commandType == CommandType.UNMARK : "Invalid command type used for NumberedCommand";
* Encapsulates commands to add tasks, with a date and potentially a timing associated to it, to the task list.
public abstract static class TimedTaskCommand extends Command {
/** The name of the task in the inputted command */
/** The date associated to the task in the inputted command */

public TimedTaskCommand(CommandType commandType, String taskName, LocalDate date, LocalTime time) {
* Encapsulates a command to add a deadline task to the task list.
public static class DeadlineCommand extends TimedTaskCommand { // deadline

* @param deadlineTime The deadline time of the task.
public DeadlineCommand(String taskName, LocalDate deadlineDate, LocalTime deadlineTime) {

* @return A message reflecting that a deadline task was added to the task list.
Task newDeadline = new TimedTask.Deadline(this.taskName, this.taskDate, this.taskTime);
* Encapsulates a command to add an event to the task list.
public static class EventCommand extends TimedTaskCommand { // event

* @param eventDate The date of the event.
* @param eventStartTime The starting time of the event.
* @param eventEndTime The ending time of the event.
public EventCommand(String taskName, LocalDate eventDate, LocalTime eventStartTime, LocalTime eventEndTime) {
* Creates a new event and adds it to the task list.
* @param taskList The task list associated with this instance of Candice.
* @return A message reflecting that an event was added to the task list.
Task newEvent = new TimedTask.Event(this.taskName, this.taskDate, this.taskTime, this.eventEndTime);
* Enumeration of all the different types of commands that can be inputted.

super("You can't just say " + taskType + " without any description.");
* Abstraction for exceptions that are thrown when no date for a task is inputted, specifically for deadlines and

* Abstraction for exceptions that are thrown when the date inputted for a task, specifically for deadlines and events,
* does not follow the format or does not exist.
* Constructor for an exception thrown when the deadline or event command inputted has an invalid date.
super("Invalid date bro. You need to write the date as DD/MM/YYYY.");
* Abstraction for exceptions that are thrown when the format of the command inputted is not valid.
* Constructor for an exception thrown when the command inputted does not have valid formatting.
* @param taskType The type of command inputted.
super("Wrong formatting for a " + taskType + " bro.");
* Abstraction for exceptions that are thrown when a command to mark a task that has already been marked as finished or
* a command to unmark a task that has already been marked as unfinished is inputted.
* Constructor for an exception thrown when an invalid mark or unmark command is inputted.
* Abstraction for exceptions that are thrown when the time inputted for a task, specifically for deadlines and events,
* does not follow the format of a LocalTime or does not exist.
* Constructor for an exception thrown when the deadline or event command inputted has an invalid time.
super("Invalid time bro. You need to write the time as a 24-hour time (1600). For events, you are required "
+ "to give the start and end time (1400-1600).");
* Abstraction for exceptions that are thrown when "undo" has been inputted when there are no commands to undo.
* Constructor for an exception thrown when an undo command has been inputted when there are no commands to undo.
super("Invalid undo my dude. There are no commands to undo");
* Abstraction for exceptions that are thrown when the command inputted has a command type that is not recognised.
* Constructor for an exception thrown when the command type is unknown.
super("I have no clue what you're trying to do bro.");

* Extends the Task class, adding on to the encapsulation of a Task object by adding dates and potentially times
* associated to certain tasks, specifically deadlines and events.
